dialog.text: Did [[Streusen]]-Sama fall on his right eye? That's quite strange, isn't it!! Good morning! I'll start the SBS. -P.N. Dori

It's not his right eye, rather he fall on the right side of his forehead, that's probably what you're talking about. In that situation he acted like an honorable man... It started alreadyyy!!!?

[[File:SBS89 Nami and Caesar.png|120px|thumb]]

qa.summary: Streusen-Sama fell on the right side of his forehead, not his right eye, and acted honorably in that situation.

dialog.text: [[Nami]]-san called [[Caesar Clown|Caesar]] “Scum”, “Garbage”, and told him that “It would be better if you died”. Did she get influenced by [[Nico Robin|Robin]]-chan’s potty-mouth (toxic-tongue)? -P.N. Dori

Please remember what happened on [[Punk Hazard]]. Caesar fed the children stimulants, called his subordinates guinea pigs, and dedicates his whole life to creating a weapon of genocide. He truly is a man where it would be better off if he was dead. Even though Nami is only kind to those in need (women and children), I truly think she hates Caesar from the bottom of her heart.

[[File:SBS89 Katakuri.png|120px|thumb]]

qa.summary: Nami's harsh words towards Caesar are due to his despicable actions and not influenced by Robin's 'toxic-tongue'; Oda confirms Nami's genuine hatred for Caesar.

dialog.text: Oda-sensei, nice to meet you! About [[Charlotte Katakuri|Katakuri]], we know that he likes to eat sweets, but in matter of disliking, what is his least favorite food, is it spicy food? -P.N. Yukito
His least favorite food is hot ramen. When dining with others, being seen while eating is his mortal weakness, which is why he hates ramen. Spicy food is fine though.

qa.summary: Katakuri's least favorite food is hot ramen; being seen while eating is his weakness, which is why he hates ramen, but spicy food is fine.

dialog.text: Hello Oda-sensei. How does Katakuri sleep? -P.N. Tattsu
Because of his myth of "strength" of his back never having touched the ground, he sleeps on walls. So basically, he leans on a wall, relaxes down, stands still and falls asleep while sitting.

qa.summary: Katakuri sleeps by leaning on a wall, relaxing, standing still, and falling asleep while sitting due to his myth of strength.

dialog.text: Oda-sensei, will you let me marry my son (three years old) to one of [[Charlotte Linlin|Big Mom]]'s daughters? Not only would I have a big power at my service, but I would also get a suuuuperrrr powerful daughter in law! What do you say, isn't is a great idea? -P.N. The Sanada family and the Charlotte family's political marriage

Yes, please do not ask me, ask Big Mom herself directly! Next!

[[File:SBS89 Bananawani.png|120px|thumb]]

qa.summary: D: Can I arrange a political marriage between my young son and Big Mom's daughter? O: Ask Big Mom directly, next question!

dialog.text: Please tell us what are [[Crocodile]] and [[Daz Bonez]]’ favorite foods and most hated foods. I think a boss like Crocodile who likes Bananawani (Banana Crocodiles) wouldn’t eat bananas or crocodile meat. My older sister thinks he dislikes mandarin oranges (mikan). We got into a fight about whether it’s hard for him to remove his fake hand. P.N. Banana Me and Mandarin Sister

{| style="margin:auto;" |[[File:SBS89 Crocodile.png|80px]]|| Crocodile:
Likes: Crocodile meat and tomatoes
Dislikes: Ketchup |[[File:SBS89 Daz.png|80px]]|| Daz Bones (Mr. 1):
Likes: Raw Ham
Dislikes: Grilled pork |} This sounds about right!! The fact that he keeps crocodiles as pets doesn’t really affect what is difficult for him to eat. When you look at what these two like to eat they sure seem like an annoying pair to please. [[File:SBS89 Luffy and Gear 4.png|120px|thumb]]

qa.summary: Crocodile likes crocodile meat and tomatoes, dislikes ketchup; Daz Bones likes raw ham, dislikes grilled pork. Their tastes make them an annoying pair to please.

dialog.text: I read the manga and watched the anime and noticed that after [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] uses [[Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 4 Techniques|Gear 4]], he not only can’t use [[Haki]] for 10 minutes but it also carries the tradeoff (risk) of being so fatigued that he can’t move. However, in [[Chapter 885|Ch. 885]] he is moving totally normally right? Why isn't that tradeoff there anymore? -P.N. BUSHI

The tradeoff of not being able to move that you’re referring to never existed in the first place. If he wanted to move but couldn’t use Haki during that time, he could still run from place to place to hide. In Dressrosa, after using Gear Fourth, he coincidentally ran into his allies and supporters so he could preserve his energy while they carried him to the next fight. If those people weren’t there then Luffy would just have to do his best!

qa.summary: Luffy's inability to move after using Gear 4 and Haki was a misunderstanding, as he could still move without Haki and coincidentally received help in Dressrosa.

dialog.text: Does semla actually exist? I want to eat it! -P.N. Odamania

Semla is a thing. it's a Swedish sweet. There was this period of time four days before Christmas where everybody fasted. it's an old tradition. Before they fasted, they ate the aforementioned "semla". The tradition in Elbaf is the same as the one of that place. I've never tried semla either. I want to eat it!

[[File:SBS89 Noisette and Oshimuna Town.png|120px|thumb]]

qa.summary: Semla is a Swedish sweet traditionally eaten four days before Christmas and is also part of Elbaf's tradition.

dialog.text: Oda-san!! Hello!! There is a place called "Oshimuna Town" in [[Volume 88|Vol. 88]] page 132, which means “don’t be stingy” town. Who is the minister of this island? - P.N. Ehara Ryōta

It may sound strange because of this weird name, but it makes more sense with the Island's name. The full name is Oshimuna Town on [[Kinko Island]]. The minister is 15th son [[Charlotte Noisette|Noisette]]. He is in charge of the finance in Totto Land. So this town means don’t be stingy about making delicious food on this Kinko Island! That's the just of it.

qa.summary: Oda explains the meaning of Oshimuna Town's name from Volume 88, revealing that the minister is Charlotte Noisette, in charge of finance in Totto Land.

dialog.text:
About the Charlotte Family's 26th son, [[Charlotte Bavarois]]' hat has net glasses on it, is it like one of those old so-called "mysterious net" hats? -P.N. Manager

[[File:SBS89 Bavarois.png|thumb|200px]]

You've got it right! That's correct, it's from a long time ago. When I was a child, all the young boys were wearing these "mysterious net" hats. Upon looking it up, it appears their correct name is "mesh" hats. I wonder if those caps can be still found around. It made me happy you noticed it. They're cool, aren't they?

qa.summary: Charlotte Bavarois's hat is inspired by 'mysterious net' hats from Oda's childhood, which he recalls as 'mesh' hats and wonders if they are still available.

dialog.text: In [[Chapter 891|Ch. 891]] [[Charlotte Flampe|Flampe]] coined the term “King of Big Brothers” who turned out to be Katakuri. Among Big Mom’s 85 children, who is the “King of Big Sisters”, “King of Little Brothers”, and “King of Little Sisters”? P.N. OP Girl that asks troublesome questions

Okay, first let’s start with what Flampe said in that chapter. The “Best Imōto-est Award” is something that Flampe selfishly hosts on her own. She is a very diligent child so she passes a survey along to everyone in the family. The final results of each sibling division are out. Let’s announce the TOP 3. [[File:SBS89 Charlotte.png|thumb|320px]]
*King of Big Brothers *#Katakuri *#[[Charlotte Oven|Oven]] *#[[Charlotte Perospero|Perospero]] *King of Little Brothers *#[[Charlotte Anglais|Anglais]] *#[[Charlotte Newgo|Newgo]] *#[[Charlotte Dolce|Dolce]] *King of Big Sisters *#[[Charlotte Smoothie|Smoothie]] *#[[Charlotte Amande|Amande]] *#[[Charlotte Brûlée|Brûlée]] *King of Little Sisters *#Flampe *#[[Charlotte Pudding|Pudding]] *#[[Charlotte Anana|Anana]]
In the first place, the contest is rigged because the number of votes each person can receive isn’t equal. The “King of Younger Sister” is really just something Flampe does for fun. [[File:SBS89 Smoothie.png|120px|thumb]]

qa.summary: Flampe's 'Best Imōto-est Award' ranks Katakuri as the 'King of Big Brothers' and reveals Smoothie as the 'King of Big Sisters'.

dialog.text: Hello Oda-sensei. I was reading [[Chapter 894|Ch. 894]] and isn’t Smoothie really huge?? Why?? What kind of power does she have? Also why is her sword wet in the same chapter? P.N. No Name OP Fan Whose Name Can Just Be That-chan

In the end, I wasn’t able to draw why that page was relevant in this arc but Smoothie ate the “[[Shibo Shibo no Mi]]” and became a dehydration human. She can squeeze the juice out of her enemies and slice them with her sword to pull out all their water content to completely dry them out. The water she steals can be stored in her own body, causing her to increase in size. She can also shoot the water out as an attack. She’s strong.

qa.summary: Smoothie ate the Shibo Shibo no Mi and can dehydrate her enemies, storing the water in her body to increase in size and shoot it out as an attack.

dialog.text: I’m a huge huge huge fan of Ace. If he didn’t die during the Summit War, what kind of face would he have? Please draw him at age 40 and age 60, Oda Eiichiro-sama~!! P.N. Daughter of Ace of the Whitebeard Crew.

Got it.
[[File:SBS89 Ace.png|thumb|300px]]

Top row:
* Age 40: Yo Luffy, still the same as always.
* Age 60: I’m retired.

Bottom row (a future if something happened/went wrong):
* Age 40: Osu Luffy, lend me some money.
* Age 60: Chopper, just a little bit from the safe…

Hard to say what would have happened over the course of his life, but I drew these two patterns (possibilities).

[[File:SBS89 Hajrudin and Stansen.png|120px|thumb]]

qa.summary: Oda draws two possible future scenarios for Ace at age 40 and 60, one where he's still the same and another where he's asking for money.

dialog.text: Odacchi, hello!! On P. 145 of [[Chapter 866]] ([[Volume 86]]), during the scene showing [[Hajrudin]]’s early childhood, there is a boy eating snacks behind him. Is this the same giant that appears on P.184 of Ch. 500, “Pirate [[Stansen]]”? P.N. C. Macaron
Good eye. You’re right, he’s Hajrudin’s childhood friend. In a very roundabout way, the man on the left (adult version) somehow ended up working under Luffy’s [[Straw Hat Grand Fleet]].

qa.summary: The boy eating snacks behind Hajrudin is indeed the same giant who appears as Pirate Stansen and is now part of Luffy's Straw Hat Grand Fleet.

dialog.text: Odacchi, hello! I am a big fan of both Odacchi and Luffy. I have a question today for Odacchi! When he was a kid, Monkey D. Garp’s eyes were the same as Luffy’s, big and round. However, when he became an adult, they became narrow. So what about Luffy’s eyes? Once he turns 20, will his eyes also become like Garp’s? -From Gokkudzuen

Okay, this question came from a translator in Vietnam in slightly awkward words. In short, will Luffy’s eyes become skinny like Garp’s once he turns 20? Since he turns 20 in only a year, I don’t think Luffy will be changing too much in such a short time. Similar to the drawings for Ace, for those wondering “What would Luffy look like at age 40 and age 60?” take a look!
[[File:SBS89 Luffy.png|thumb|300px]]

Top row:
* Age 40: Meat!!
* Age 60: Meat!!!

Bottom row (a future where something happened):
* Age 40: Pirate king? Don’t be such a dreamer.
* Age 60: Is that meat available for the taking?
{{-}}

Right, in a future where things go well, he looks quite a lot like Garp doesn’t he? But in a future where something, somehow happens then who knows!! Okay, SBS is done!! Looking forward to next time!!

qa.summary: Oda doesn't think Luffy's eyes will change like Garp's at 20; his future drawings show Luffy at 40 and 60 resembling Garp if things go well.
